dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two-lane road carves through an endless forest of tower black spruce. A flock of pintails skims over the treetops heading south before the first snowfall. A young BOY (12), undersized and feral, trudges home, boo strapped to his back. Black-haired and pale-skinned, the looks as if he hasn't had a good meal in a long time. Before we hear anything the boy turns, watching the bend the road behind him. After a moment we hear the thrum of hard-charging engine. An Oldsmobile Super 88 rounds the bend, accelerating as i hits the straightaway. The boy steps away from the road b the car comes straight at him. The boy closes his eyes. The Oldsmobile's brakes clamp do on the wheels and the car shivers to a halt with inches t spare. Laughter spills from the car's open windows. Four HIGH SCHOOL LETTERMEN pile out of the car, wearing t leather-sleeved football jackets. GILMAN, the largest of four, shakes his head and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: GILMAN
dialogues.text: Kid didn't even move. You see that? Where's your survival instincts, boy? The boy says nothing. He readjusts his bookbag and resume his long walk northward. GILMAN (cont'd) Hey! Gilman grabs the boy's shoulder and spins him around- GILMAN (cont'd) The hell you going? You hear me talking to you? One of the other football players, MASON, walks over and inspects the boy's face.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: This is the kid whose old man robbed the truck stop last year. Gilman curls his meaty hand around the back of the boy's and pulls him closer, scrutinizing him. The four letterme tower over the small boy. I C_ONTTNTT f 1

dialogues.speaker: GILMAN
dialogues.text: You the one with the convict daddy? The boy stares back at Gilman, unblinking.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: GILMAN
dialogues.text: What's the matter, you about to piss your pants? Answer me. The boy says nothing, never looking away from the bully. Gilman presses his fist, adorned with a heavy class ring, against the.boy's cheek. GILMAN (cont'd) You a tough guy like your daddy? Gilman shoves the boy, forcing him to stumble backwards. boy regains his balance, never taking his eyes off Gilman GILMAN (cont'd) You want to play tough guy with me? Huh? Provoked by the boy's lack of fear, by the insolence of h stare, Gilman rears back and punches him in the face. The boy falls to the ground. Blood spills from a gash in cheek where the class ring cut him.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (a ringside announcer) Right cross to the face... and he's down! The football players laugh, looking down at the fallen bo The boy stands. There is still no sign of emotion on his face. No fear, no anger, no evident pain.

dialogues.speaker: GILMAN
dialogues.text: What's the matter? You want some more? The boy doesn't look away. The bully swings, cracking the in the side of the head, knocking him down again. GILMAN (cont'd) (to his friends) Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Walking back to the car, Mason slaps Gilman on the should

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You gave that little pissant something to think about. Gilman grins and looks back at the boy, expecting him to sprawled and crying on the ground. Instead the boy stands again, brushes the dirt off his sh and walks toward Gilman.

dialogues.speaker: GILMAN
dialogues.text: You got to be kidding me. I'm gonna knock the-- But Gilman's words die in his throat as he sees something impossible happening. The gash on the boy's cheek knits itself shut, leaving no sign of injury. Gilman is so shocked he doesn't see the boy's fist whizzi toward him, striking him in the nose. And then another pu And then another. The boy is far smaller and weaker than Gilman, but he fig with a ferocity that seems inhuman, punching and kicking headbutting, doing whatever it takes to fell his enemy. Gilman, stunned by the intensity of the assault, goes dow trying to protect his face from the blur of blows. Mason tries to pull the boy off his friend and suffers a to the hand. He howls with pain and backs off. The other two football players, amazed to see their leade getting pummeled by a boy half his size, watch in awe. The boy growls as he batters the bully. He grabs Gilman's collar and lifts the football player's head off the groun prepared to deliver the coup de grace with his right fist Three bone claws spring from the boy's hand, serrated and razor sharp. Everything stops. Mason, clutching his wounded hand, quit hollering and stares. The other two football players blin and slowly back away. Even Gilman, moaning on the ground, hushes and tries to c backwards, away from this beast on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But the boy is more shocked than-any of them. He stares w horror at the claws, this part of him he never knew exist He stands and stumbles away from Gilman. Mason runs over, lifts his punch-drunk friend to his feet, and hustles him toward the Oldsmobile. The other football players pile in, slam the doors shut, speed off, leaving the boy alone by the side of the road. The boy stares at his claws and for the first time we see fear in his eyes. He screams, a scream that echoes over t black spruce, into the darkening northern sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOGAN wakes. with a wordless shout, sitting upright, shirtless, in a bed covered with shredded bedsheets. KAYLA SILVERFOX (25) wraps her arms around him and whispe in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: It's okay... shh... it's okay. Logan pants, chest heaving, eyes wild, gripping the tatte sheets in his fists. Kayla holds him tight until his bone claws retract. KAYLA (cont'd) I'm right here with you. Okay? I'm right here with you. Kayla, a full-blooded Innu, wears her long black hair pul back in a ponytail. She's been sleeping in one of Logan's flannel shirts. KAYLA (cont'd) The war dreams or the one where you're a kid? Logan takes a deep breath, finally calming down. He relax into Kayla's arms.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: The one where I'm a kid. Kayla runs her fingers through his thick hair, kissing hi forehead. He sees that she has a small cut on her forearm takes her arm and looks at the wound.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOGAN (cont'd) I cut you.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: It's nothing. Just a scratch. She kisses him. KAYLA (cont'd) We need new sheets again, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traveling carnival has come to a seaside New England to The brightly-lit Ferris Wheel spins a few hundred yards inland from the dark Atlantic. LOCALS roam through the carnival, lining up to ride the T A-Whirl. KIDS carrying plumes of cotton candy race from s 'em-up games to free throw competitions. A CARNY BARKER of the old school, wearing a patched-suit a derby, beckons the curious to his attraction.

dialogues.speaker: CARNY BARKER
dialogues.text: Come see the notorious Bird Man! Half-man, half-eagle, is he an angel from Heaven or a spawn of Satan? Ladies and gentlemen, tonight is your last chance to see the creature you've all been hearing about: We follow two BOYS who hand the barker their tickets, pul aside the curtain and step into the sideshow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .joining a small crowd of CURIOUS ONLOOKERS. The tent is dark save for a spotlight fixed on a tiny stage. SHERRLENE, a peroxide-blonde in her fifties, whose tanned hide is covered with interlaced tattoos, slaps a tribal b on a pair of bongos. The crowd hushes. A tall man in a hooded robe shuffles to the stage like a boxer long past his prime. He stands in front of the gawkers, head bowed, face shadowed by his ho

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Finally BEAK throws off his robe and raises his wings to crowd. As advertised, he looks like an amalgam of man and bird, with three-toed, clawed feet and dirty-feathered wi His very human, tired brown eyes are set in a face domina by a long sharp beak. He stares back at the gaping crowd. Beak looks more pathetic than monstrous. His skinny limbs don't seem very strong and he projects an air of weary resignation, not menace. But when he flaps his gray wings and caws at the onlooker the children shriek in terror and bury their faces in the father's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherrlene and Beak sit at a card table, playing gin and drinking bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRLENE
dialogues.text: I'm gonna knock with three.

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? He throws down his hand in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRLENE
dialogues.text: You always hold out for gin. You could have knocked a while ago.

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'm an eternal. optimist. Sherrlene tallies the points.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRLENE
dialogues.text: All right, I'm gonna hit it. You want to come look for shells with me on the beach tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: I don't want to scare away any tourists.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRLENE
dialogues.text: Aw, sweetie, it's winter. No tourists. I'll come get you in the morning. (rr)NTTNTrJ r) 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sherrlene collects her things, stands, and kisses Beak on side of his feathered head.

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: Goodnight, Sherrlene.

dialogues.speaker: SHERRLENE
dialogues.text: Night, Beak. Sweet dreams. Sherrlene closes the door behind her and Beak flips throu the deck of cards, preparing for another lonely night. A knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: You forget your purse? (another knock) All right, all right, I'm coming. He stands and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A towering figure in a long black coat looms beside the trailer's door.

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: Show's over, pal. VICTOR CREED is shrouded in shadows, but when he grins hi white fangs gleam. He drapes his arm around Beak and drag the birdman inside the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Show's never over for you, freak..

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: You want money? There's twenty bucks on the dresser. That's all I

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: I just want to hear you talk a minute before I cut your lungs out. Creed shoves Beak back into his seat, picks up the bottle bourbon, examines the label, and guzzles it. Beak opens h mouth but no words come out. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: You're the one that's been killing mutants. Creed wipes his lips with the back of his clawed hand. BEAK (cont'd) But you... you're one of us.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Us? There's no us. There's you and there's me, and in a minute, just me. Creed smiles down at his feathered target. Beak tries to shield his body with his wings.

dialogues.speaker: BEAK
dialogues.text: Please... I never hurt anybody, my whole life...

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Let me show you how it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awful, prolonged shriek escapes from the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small log cabin sits in a clearing in a jack pine for Winter has come to the north country; the ground and tree branches are covered with several inches of snow. Logan chops firewood behind the cabin, splitting the logs with expert axe strikes, smoking a cheap cigar. His nose wrinkles as he sniffs the air. LOGAN. Smells like government. Behind Logan, two approaching men in dark suits and black overcoats glance at each other. Logan, halving another bl of wood, doesn't turn around. One of the newcomers, STRYKER, was a colonel in the Speci Forces. He still has the look. His hair is cropped short, bearing is military, and his blue eyes are fierce. f r_ONTTNTJF D

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CHRISTOPH NORD, A.K.A. AGENT ZERO, looks more like a deat row convict than a military man. A family of tattooed spi walk down his neck.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even showered today. Logan turns, the axe gripped in his hand. STRYKER (cont'd) Been a long time, Logan. You haven't aged a day. Everyone else gets old and gray, but not you.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: We never lost you, my friend. I believe you know my colleague? Logan and Agent Zero stare at each other. There is a hist between these two and clearly the memories are not fond. STRYKER (cont'd) We're with the Department of Agriculture now.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Agriculture? You working with farmers? Agent Zero grins. There is nothing pleasant about his gri

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Pest Control Division. Working with exterminators.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (puffing on his cigar) Still shooting first, asking questions later? In one blindingly fast motion, Agent Zero pulls a customi automatic from his shoulder holster, fires, and reholster

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Still smoking cheap cigars? Logan spits the butt of the severed cigar from his mouth clenches his fists.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: That was a buck twenty-five, asshole. Stryker holds up both hands, one palm to Logan, one to Ze

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Boys, please. (to Logan) Could we take a minute of your time?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You're taking it.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: We want you back. Logan turns away from them. He tosses aside the axe, pick a load of firewood and . stacks. it beside the cabin. STRYKER (cont'd) You're a born warrior. You can hide up here as long as you want, that's never gonna change.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: It's... creative work, I can assure you of that. And it pays well.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Already got a job.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Lumberjack. Eighteen grand a.year.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Eighteen five.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: You content chopping down trees?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I am. It's good work. And I haven't killed anybody in three years.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Starting to miss it?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Right about now I am. Agent Zero grins, enjoying the game. Stryker, seeing that this is going badly, tries to break the tension.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: We're putting together a team. Best men in the business. Men with... special qualities. Men like you.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Forget it. Logan walks around to the front of the cabin. Stryker and Agent Zero follow. Logan's battered old pickup truck is parked beside the newcomers' Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: It's a team of hunters. We're going after some very bad people. Logan climbs into the driver's seat. STRYKER (cont'd) You read the papers, Logan? They're killing mutants. Logan closes the door, turns the key and revs the engine warm it. Stryker taps on the window. Logan grits his teet and rolls down the window, not looking at the colonel. STRYKER (cont'd) Listen to me. They have names. They have addresses.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: All right, forget about yourself. Your country needs you.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I'm Canadian. He hits the gas, forcing Stryker to jump back lest the ti run over his foot. Stryker and Agent Zero watch him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan parks in the lot of a sprawling brick grammar schoo He gets out of the truck and walks toward the main buildi The school day has ended. STUDENTS meet up with their MOM DADS for the ride home. As Logan rounds a corner, he stops in his tracks, looking around. Something's not quite right. Logan'ducks his head at the last. possible second and a snowball whizzes past, missing him by inches. Six FOURTH GRADERS (four boys and two girls) charge at hi hurling snowballs and screaming.

dialogues.speaker: FOURTH GRADERS
dialogues.text: Get him! Logan jumps back around the corner, out of sight. The fou graders chase after him, round the corner with their thro hands cocked, ready to launch some serious ice. Logan is nowhere in sight. The fourth graders turn in confused circles, searching fo their target, snowballs melting in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, fellas. The boys and girls look up and see Logan sitting on a sec floor window ledge. He has already formed six perfect snowballs, with which he proceeds to pelt the fourth grad The kids run, screaming and laughing, nearly colliding wi Kayla, who rounds the corner and stares up at Logan.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Nice. Logan, caught with a snowball in his hand, looks sheepish

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: They started it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan drives Kayla home over roads slick with black ice. sings softly along with the country song on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Stryker came by the house today.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Stryker? Colonel Stryker? The one you told me about? (off Logan's nod) What did he want?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Wants me back.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Told him no.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: So why can't they get someone else? Logan thinks about it for a moment. When he speaks there degree of self-loathing in his tone.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I'm the best there is at what I do. And what I do best isn't very nice. Kayla studies the side of his face for a moment. LOGAN (cont'd) Maybe he's right. Maybe it's the only thing I'm good for. Kayla watches him. Logan shakes his head as if ridding himself of an errant thought. LOGAN (cont'd) Son of a bitch had me thinking about it for a minute. He wraps his arm around her shoulders and pulls her close f CONTTN11Fn1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOGAN (cont'd) I'm not going anywhere. First time in my life, I don't feel like a freak.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hey. You're not a freak.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Most guys don't have to worry about gutting their girlfriend when they have a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You're not a freak. You've got a gift.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: A gift? Logan shakes his head, staring at the black ribbon of roa LOGAN (cont'd) You can return a gift..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A well-built fire burns in the fireplace. Logan and Kayla naked in front of it, wrapped in an old flannel quilt.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: The kids made cornhusk dolls today in Arts and Crafts. She reaches for her bag and pulls out a little doll. KAYLA (cont'd) I made one for you. Kayla hands him the doll and he examines it by firelight. Given the limitations of the art form, it's a skillful representation of Logan, unique hairstyle and all.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I look like Elvis.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You're Elvis with claws. The moon, swollen and red-hued, rises above the dark hill framed in the cabin's window. I coNTTNTTRn 1

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Full moon tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You know why the moon's so lonely? Logan shakes his head. Kayla lies back, resting her head Logan's leg as he plays with her hair. KAYLA (cont'd) She used to have a lover. Kuekuatsheu. They lived in the Spirit World and every night they'd wander the skies together. But one of the other spirits was jealous. Trickster wanted the Moon for himself. So he told Kuekuatsheu the Moon asked for flowers. He told him to come to our world and pick her some wild roses.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Never trust a guy named Trickster.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you do some stupid things when you're in love. Kuekuatsheu didn't know that once you leave the Spirit World, you can never go back. Now he's trapped here. Every night the Moon searches for him and every night he sees her in the sky and howls her name... but he can never touch her again. For a moment they're both quiet, contemplating the sad my

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Koo-koo-choo got screwed.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Kuekuatsheu. The Wolverine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewed from a distance, the little cabin looks warm and inviting, the firelight shining from the windows. Something watches from the edge. of the dark woods. Somet monstrous, its black talons carving gashes in the trunk o pine tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla drops Logan off at the logging camp. The site is already loud with motorized activity. TRIMMERS remove the limbs from fallen trees. TEAMSTERS in forklifts load logs onto flatbed trucks. Logan comes around to the driver's side window, holding h orange Husqvarna chainsaw in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Be careful. Logan bends forward to kiss her on the lips. He turns and walks towards a crew of LUMBERJACKS circled around a SUPERVISOR with a clipboard. Logan turns when he hears a honk. Kayla leans out the win KAYLA (cont'd) I love you, by the way. Logan notices that dozens of lumberjacks are watching thi scene. He clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: T love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: (thick Maine accent) We all love you, Casanova, but could we get to work here? We need to let some daylight in the swamp. The lumberjacks laugh loudly. Damage done, Kayla waves a cheerful goodbye and drives away from the camp. Logan trudges into the circle of lumberjacks, who make ki kissie sounds and slap his shoulder. SUPERVISOR (cont'd) All right, I need a team of choppers for 3B, that's gonna be Phelan, Marcuse, Van Mier and Logan. Two teams for 3C...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla steers the pickup along the access road leading awa from the logging camp. C'C)NTTNTTF.n )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An eighteen-wheel flatbed loaded with trimmed logs blocks road. Men in reflective vests stand on the flatbed, secur the load with chains. Kayla hits the brakes and checks-her watch. She's late. S taps the horn. A FOREMAN ambles over to her, in no particular rush.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Can't move the truck till the load's tied down.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Please? I'm already late.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen, ma'am... The foreman thinks about it, sighs, and changes his tune. FOREMAN (cont'd) (yelling to truck driver) Hey Zeke! Pull this mother over. Lady's got to get through. Moments later the truck rolls forward, enabling Kayla to scoot through in her pickup. She toots her horn and waves

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Thanks, fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan and three other lumberjacks-- PHELAN, MARCUSE, and MIER-- tramp through the woods towards their designated a carrying their chainsaws and helmets. Phelan, whiskey-bellied and flushed from the exertion, ha fallen behind.

dialogues.speaker: PHELAN
dialogues.text: You all want to ease the pace a little bit? Trees ain't going anywhere. Logan, in the lead, stares at a crude smiley face carved a tall pine tree. His gaze travels from the carving to something sitting on the forest floor. (CON'TNt1F.n I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lB.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PHELAN (cont'd) What you got there? The other lumberjacks gather around Logan. A severed bear head, haloed by buzzing flies, rots in the sun. PHELAN (cont'd) Goddamn.

dialogues.speaker: VAN MIER
dialogues.text: Hunter?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUSE
dialogues.text: Why would a hunter leave the head?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Bullet didn't kill this bear. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claws did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla sings along with the tape on the tape deck.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Lolly Lolly Lolly get your adverbs here, Lolly Lolly Lolly got some adverbs here, Come on down to Lolly's get the adverbs here... Rounding a corner on the narrow access road, Kayla nearly collides with a man in a long black coat. She slams on th brakes and the truck shudders to a halt. The man's back is turned to the truck, his head bowed. Hi hair hangs below his shoulders, clotted with dirt, as if been sleeping in the woods for weeks. Kayla leans out of the open truck window. Before she can speak, the man in the long black coat turns. It's not just his size that frightens us, though the man massive. It's not just the four-inch-long black talons curling from his fingertips, or the gleaming fangs he lic as he smiles at her. What terrifies us most are his eyes. They are a shark's e black and loveless and utterly inhuman. f CONTTNT1FD'

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Victor Creed walks toward the truck. He scrapes his talon over the hood: screeeeee. Five parallel gashes now scar t hood, carved straight through the steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, hearing a noise the other men can't, rises from hi crouch. He looks to the west, listening carefully.

dialogues.speaker: PHELAN
dialogues.text: What's the matter-- Logan holds up a hand: quiet. He hears a distant scream. voice he knows better than any other. He runs, leaving his astonished co-workers behind. No one can run through the woods faster than Logan and'Lo has never needed to run faster. He vaults fallen trees, d under branches, accelerates when he hits the access road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sees the pickup truck in the distance. Even a hundr yards away he can tell that something is.wrong. It seems impossible that he could run any faster, but now does, reaching the truck in seconds. He sees the claw mar gouged through the steel hood. He sees.the driver's side door tossed onto the asphalt tw yards. from the truck. And finally he sees Kayla, curled in the fetal position o the side of the access road. Blood puddles beneath her. H skin has already begun to lose its 'color. He runs to her, kneels beside her body, hands checking fo pulse, listening for breath, trying desperately to find a sign of life in her lifeless form.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Come on, you're okay. Say something. Say something, darling. Say something. Kayla, come on. He cradles her in his arms. LOGAN (cont'd) You're okay. You're okay.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He rocks back and forth, her lifeless body clutched tight in his arms, his eyes clenched shut. The veins bulge in his neck, every muscle in his body ten as if there were a beast inside him trying to break free his skin. INT. CASADY'S BAR & GRILL - DAY The local dive opens early. TOWN DRUNKS sit by themselves smoking cigarettes, sipping the day's first hair-of--the- reading the paper or staring into their beer. Victor Creed sits at the bar, carving a crude smiley face into the wood with the claw of his index finger. He looks and sees the BARTENDER staring at him. The bartender does approve of the vandalism, but he's not about to say anyth Creed taps the rim of his glass. The bartender comes over with a bottle of George Dickel Tennessee whiskey. He fill Creed's glass halfway-- a standard pour. Creed stares at the bartender. He taps the glass again. T bartender, hand shaking, fills the glass to the brim. Creed raises the whiskey to the light.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Stuff don't work on me. I drink and drink and I never feel any different. He downs the full glass of whiskey with a swallow. He loo around the bar, at the pool table in the back, the Wurlit jukebox, the stacked bottles of liquor. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) You got any insurance on this place?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Insurance? I guess so. Why? Creed wipes his mouth with the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: 'Cause it's about to get ugly. Logan walks into the tavern, sniffing the air. He sees Cr sitting on the barstool, back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan approaches the bar, never taking his eyes off creed Finally Creed turns to look at Logan. He stands, towering above the smaller man. Logan sees a splotch of dried blood on the back of Creed' hand. Creed knows Logan is looking at it. He lifts his ha to his mouth and licks the blood off. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) Sweet girl. Tasted like strawberry jam. The bone claws burst from Logan's hands, pale, white, and serrated. He growls and swings at Creed's head. The big man is fast. He ducks under the claws, grinning a circling like a boxer, happy that he's finally got a dece adversary. The bartender and the local drunks have seen plenty of ba fights, but not ones featuring clawed mutants. They run. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) You can scare off the civilians with those, sonny boy. But I got claws of my own. He swings, raking his talons across Logan's chest, drawin first blood. Logan lunges at Creed and the battle begins. -The pace of the combat is startling, the physical power stupendous. A missed swipe by Creed ends with him clawing the guts of the jukebox. Logan jumps at his enemy and get swatted into the wall, smashing the plasterboard. Creed grabs Logan by the collar and tosses him onto the p table. Creed brings his fist down, looking to pulverize Logan's skull, but the smaller man rolls clear. Creed's f shatters the slate and the table collapses. Clearing his head on the sawdusted floor, Logan sees the eight ball rolling past. He picks it up and hurls it at Creed's head. Creed catches the eight ball in his left hand and squeeze his fist shut. He opens his hand and lets the powdered remains spill onto the floor. Logan springs to his feet and swings at creed, again and again, his claws whooshing through the air. l CONTTNTJRT) )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Creed, despite his bulk, is an elegant fighter. He circle just out of reach, grinning as the claws slash past his f Creed grabs Logan's right wrist as it flies by. He grabs left wrist. His wet fangs glisten as they plunge toward Logan's throat.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: With no room to dodge, Logan drives his head forward, smashing Creed's face with a glorious headbutt.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: As Creed staggers back, Logan kicks him in the chest, knocking the big man over the bar, where he crashes into bottles of liquor and slides to the floor in a tumult of glass shards and alcohol. Logan sees a lit cigarette in an ashtray on one of the tables. He picks the butt up and flicks it over the bar. The cigarette ignites the spilt alcohol. Creed roars and rises to his feet, a burning man. He vaults over the bar and advances on Logan. The flames consume his overcoat, licking at his skin. Creed slaps th out with his palms, apparently oblivious to the pain. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) You put up a better fight than your girl did. Creed snatches Logan and slings him headfirst through the plate glass window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan hits the snow-covered pavement hard, splinters -of in his hair, his face bloodied from dozens of small cuts. Creed steps out the bar. As Logan struggles to his feet C kicks out his legs and drops him again. Creed crouches beside Logan, grabs the back of his head, smashes his face into the concrete. The beating gets savage, creed hammering Logan again and again. Logan's healing factor cannot keep up with the violence being done to his body.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Time you got declawed, kitty kat. Creed lifts his heavy black boot and brings it down hard the extended claws of Logan's left hand.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan howls as the-bone claws shatter. Creed repeats the process on Logan's right hand. VICTOR CREED. (cont'd) You were a tough little guy. But there's always someone tougher. Creed plunges his clawed hand into Logan's chest. Logan gasps, eyes widening. His tolerance for pain is world-cla but this is another level of suffering. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) And it's always me. Creed stands, staring down at Logan's unmoving body. Sire moan in the distance. Creed walks away. Logan bleeds in the snow. We rise above him, higher and higher, his battered body dwindling as we rise with the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MALE NURSES shove a gurney down the corridor. Logan i flat on his back, bloody and unconscious. A SURGEON hurries after them, pulling on latex gloves.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: We know what we're looking at? MALE NURSE #1. Bar fight.

dialogues.speaker: MALE NURSE
dialogues.text: Multiple knife wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The male nurses transfer Logan from the gurney to the operating bed. One FEMALE NURSE prepares Logan's arm for IV while a second NURSE cuts open his blood-soaked shirt surgical scissors. The frenetic activity in the room ceases. Everyone stares Logan's unblemished chest.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON
dialogues.text: What is this? ( CO749TNnFn )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan lunges forward, grabbing the surgeon's collar and pulling the startled man's face next to his own.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MALE NURSE
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, easy-- The male nurses struggle to restrain Logan but he's too strong for them. The surgeon gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: His name is Victor Creed. Logan turns and sees Stryker standing at the entrance to operating room. STRYKER (cont'd) I can help you find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan storms out of the hospital, followed by Stryker.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: He escaped from an ultramax penitentiary in Nevada last year. Started murdering mutants. Shape- changer in New Mexico, pair of telekinetic twins in California-- Logan turns on Stryker, grabbing the colonel by the throa and shoving him against a lamp post.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Three years I been here. Three years everything's good. Nobody knows me. And then one day you show up and the next day she's dead.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: I came to warn you--

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You knew he was coming. f CONTTNfJRD 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stryker shakes his head as well as he can with Logan's ha on his throat. Stryker's face is turning red. LOGAN (cont'd) How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: He got the List.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What list? Stryker chokes, gasping for air. Logan eases up on his gr but doesn't release the man. Stryker takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: The List. Every known mutant in North America. Government's been keeping it for years. Names, addresses, everything.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: How did he get it?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Someone must have leaked it to him. There are people in Washington who want to see you all destroyed. Logan releases Stryker. The ex-colonel straightens his ja collar and composes himself.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Creed's a mutant, too.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Apparently he doesn't have much tribal loyalty. Logan turns and walks away. He looks like a homeless man, clothes torn and bloodied, his hair disheveled. He walks fast. Stryker calls after him. STRYKER (cont'd) Do you have a plan, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I'm not in the Army anymore.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Do you have a plan? CnNTTNT TF.Tf 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan turns and stares at Stryker.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I'm gonna track him down and I'm gonna end him. That's the plan.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: You already tried that. He's a hundred miles away and you're walking out of the hospital. Logan's fists are clenched. He's ready to hammer Stryker the ground, but the older man does not back down. STRYKER (cont'd) You can't beat him. Not the way you are right now. You've probably gone your whole life without losing a fight, but I'm telling you now, you can't beat him. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless I give you the tools. Logan glares at Stryker, still itching for immediate reve STRYKER (cont'd) You come with me, I promise you two things. You will suffer more pain than any other man could bear. And you will have your revenge. Logan stares into Stryker's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black helicopter lands on a concrete helipad inside the walls of the massive compound. SENTRIES armed with assault rifles man the guard towers, scanning the perimeter with binoculars. Logan, Stryker and Agent Zero step out of the helicopter. Logan glances around the foreboding place before followin Stryker inside the main building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan lies on his back on an examining table, naked save a strategically-placed towel. (-ONTTNTTFr) l

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A red-bearded scientist, DR. CORNELIUS, draws blood from Logan with a syringe. An Army surgeon, CAROL HINES, marks Logan's skin with an indelible pen. He looks like a Maori warrior, his body ma with strange lines, dots and x's. Stryker watches Hines w

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Could you unsheath your claws? Logan raises his left hand. The bone claws pop out, the s length they were before Creed shattered them. STRYKER (cont'd) Remarkable. Full regeneration. Logan examines the markings on his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: The hell you planning on doing to me? Hines gives Stryker a worried look but he ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: We're going to make you indestructible. But first we have to destroy you. Stryker heads for the door but stops midway and turns. STRYKER (cont'd) I forgot to give you something. He reaches into his jacket pocket, pulls out an old set o dog tags and tosses them to Logan. Logan inspects the tag with ambivalence.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Never wanted to put these on again.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Held on to them for years. Figured you'd be back one day. Logan slips the steel chain over his head. STRYKER (cont'd) (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you'll always know your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker walks down a long concrete corridor lit by fluorescent ceiling lights. Hines steps out of the prep r and hurries after him.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Sir? Stryker stops and waits.for her to catch up. HINES (cont'd) I know we've discussed this before-- He knows what she's going to say. He shakes his head and continues down the hallway, forcing Hines to chase after

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Ad nauseam, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Anesthetic won't work on him. His healing factor neutralizes drugs. Including painkillers.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: He can handle the pain.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: We've never conducted any animal

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: No other animal would survive the experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, wearing a hospital-style robe, stands by the close door. No other human could hear the conversation down the hallway. Logan catches every word.

dialogues.speaker: HINES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He might not, either. There's a significant chance the procedure will kill him. (C_l)NTTNTTFn )

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Correct. Some experiments succeed, some fail. That's why we call them "experiments."

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: The man's well-being is not my concern. Proving that the science works-- that's what matters. Hines does not relish confrontation and she's afraid of Stryker. But she gives it one more try.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Sir... I took the Hippocratic Oath. I swore I'd never intentionally harm another human being. Stryker turns on Hines, jabbing his finger at her.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: You also swore. to protect your nation. You remember that oath, Lieutenant Hines?

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Yes sir, but I don't understand why-

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: I don't need you to understand. I need you to follow orders. Stryker continues down the corridor, leaving Hines standi alone in the fluorescent light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines enters the room to find Logan sitting on the examin table, paging through a magazine. He smiles up at her.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You ready for me, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines and two MEDICAL TECHNICIANS accompany Logan to a wa filled plexiglass tank the size of a lidless coffin. ((Y)NTTN1WS) )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An array of stainless-steel machines crowds around the ta including a series of robotic arms that taper into foot-l needles. One wall of the theater is glass. Behind the glass is the control room, where Stryker looks on, hands behind his ba Dr. Cornelius and several SUPPORT STAFF enter data into computers monitoring the experiment. Logan removes his robe and hands it to Hines before stepp into the tank of water.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: See you on'the other side. One of the technicians fastens a breathing tube, connecte an oxygen tank, to Logan's mouth. Logan lies down, submerging himself in the cold water. Th technician clamps Logan's wrists and ankles into place wi stainless-steel shackles bolted to the plexiglass walls. Logan's eyes are open as he watches the robotic arms swiv into place, poised above him like a gang of metal vipers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL MUNSON stands in the back of the room, observing experiment with great interest. Agent Zero leans against the back wall, bored, cracking h knuckles. Hines takes a seat beside Cornelius, who studies a readou his computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Adamantium temperature?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Steady at eighty-two eleven.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Feed lines clear?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Lines one through twelve clear.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Prepare insertion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan lies underwater, watching as the robotic arms desce toward him. The needles begin to spin at high speed, like massive power drills. They churn the water when they ente CLOSE on Logan's eyes as the needles enter his body. The has suffered gunshots and knife wounds, car crashes and bottles smashed across his face. He has never suffered th He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Commence feed. The technicians enter commands, watching close-up images the procedure on their monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan writhes in the tank. Twelve long needles have drill into his bones, including his skull.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Feed commenced at a rate of twenty nine cc's per second.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Density probe indicates preliminary chelation of the compact tissue.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Body temperature?

dialogues.speaker: HINES, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: One zero two point three.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Heart rate?

dialogues.speaker: HINES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: One sixty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker turns and addresses the general. (C_C)NTTNTTF.T) )

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: You're witnessing medical history in the making. We've begun bonding adamantium to Weapon X's skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON I
dialogues.text: We tried to use that stuff for tank armor. Too damn expensive.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: It took us three years to prepare enough alloy for the skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: So if this works, I guess Weapon X won't be walking through any metal detectors.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: If this works, General, Weapon X will walk wherever he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan spasms in the tank like a man being electrocuted.

dialogues.speaker: HINES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Heart rate one ninety.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Density?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Four four seven. CLOSE on Logan's clenched eyelids and CLOSER still, enter the mind of the tortured man. Horrific images flicker past, selected traumas from a dee traumatic life. Logan cradles the lifeless body of Kayla Silverfox. The feral boy stares at his monstrous claws and howls. Logan (looking identical in age to the man we've been following) stands in a village in Vietnam as bamboo huts- around him.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: How long before he's mission operative?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Remains to be seen. We're in uncharted territory here.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: Uncharted territory is a pretty good description of your budget, Colonel. This doesn't work, you can kiss the Eleven good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: We need the Eleven. Our victory in the war to come depends on it.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: Not everyone in the Pentagon thinks there's gonna be a war. Stryker turns and fixes his gaze on the general.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Oh, it's coming, General. The enemy walks among us. We'd better be prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan thrashes in the tank, his convulsions increasingly violent, his eyes rolling back in their sockets. The wate the tank begins to steam. The reel of blood-stained images from Logan's past contin A bull-necked man beats the feral boy with an axe handle.

dialogues.speaker: HINES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Body temperature one zero eight. Heart rate two ten. Sir-- A dying Russian lies on his back on a dock in Odessa, sta at the sky, his shirt punctured with three precise holes. Logan stares down at him, bone claws extended. (CONTTNi1FT)1

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: He's a warrior, Hines. He can handle it. Victor Creed plunges his clawed hand into Logan's gut.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Density?

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Probe rejected, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: Is there a problem? Stryker allows himself a small smile.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: On the contrary. The probe is diamond-tipped. It's not hard enough to penetrate adamantium.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Heart rate two twenty five. Sir, we're well beyond maximum--

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: You're trained to care for humans, Doctor. Weapon X is not one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan writhes in the tank, muscles coiling and uncoiling. montage of nightmares continues, snapshots from Hell. The feral boy sits alone in the back of a school. bus. Wh the other children talk and laugh, he cuts his thumb with pocket knife and watches the wound heal.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Chelation near completion.

dialogues.speaker: HINES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Heart rate two forty four... two fifty... two fifty seven...

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Adamantiumreservoir ninety percent depleted.

dialogues.speaker: HINES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Core temperature one hundred and nineteen degrees. .A young Stryker, wearing jungle fatigues and a necklace human ears, holds a revolver to the temple of a sobbing V Cong prisoner. Stryker smiles as he pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker leans close to the glass, watching his test subje agony. His experiment will succeed or fail in the next fe moments. Sweat beads his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Easy now. TSURGICAL THEATER - CONTINUOUS ГЇВїВЅ.., .,. Adamantium claws burst from Logan's hand, shimmering underwater. Crazed with pain, he carves through the walls of the plexiglass tank. Steaming water cascades onto the poured concrete floor. Bursting free of his restraints, Logan slashes through th robotic arms. Sparks dance like a swarm of fireflies. The dismembered machines twitch like wounded beasts. Logan rises from the broken tank, drenched with water, na save for dozens of long stainless steel needles drilled i his body and the wires and hoses trailing from the needle Hair matted to his head, eyes wild, face contorted, he lo like a strange amalgam of machine and animal. He tears th breathing tube from his mouth and stares through the wind into the control room, panting, claws extended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines sits very still, hand over her mouth. Cornelius and technicians rise from their chairs and slowly back away f the window.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The general stares at Logan, awed by the sight of the liv weapon. Even Agent Zero no longer looks bored.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Magnificent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan slashes through the locks of the steel-reinforced theater door. He charges out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment there is silence in the control room.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: I take it this is still part of the plan, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: He's got nowhere to run. Closed circuit monitors show Logan running down a tunnel. STRYKER (cont'd) The only exit is a 25 ton blast door. It was built to withstand a nuclear detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan hurries down a long tunnel hewn through solid rock, leaving a trail of watery footprints. He stops in front o the battleship-steel door at the end of the tunnel. Growling, he carves through the door as if it were cardbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The savaged blast door flickers on the monitors. Logan Is free. The general stares at Stryker. Stryker licks his li

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: (to Agent Zero) Alert the containment team. Bring him back. (( r)NTTNTJF.J) )

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Bagged or breathing?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Either way. Just bring him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full moon shines down on the frozen landscape. Logan ha exited the Alkali Lake complex beyond the high walls of t compound. The lake itself shimmers in the moonlight. Logan stares at the lonely moon. A wolf howls in the distance. His breath rises above him in the cold air; his wet hair freezes. Ignoring the gusting wind and bitter chill, he r through the snow toward the distant woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan runs. Pine trees tower above him. He enters a clear where the virgin snow glitters beneath the moon. He stops moving and peers through the darkness. He smells something coming closer. A pack of GRAY WOLVES emerges from the woods, surrounding Logan. Snow dusts their fur. They look hungry, their blue eyes unblinking as they watch this pale interloper. The LEADER OF THE PACK, a muscular brute far bigger than comrades, snarls at Logan. Logan stares back at the wolf. The wolf jumps at Logan, fangs bared, aiming for the man' throat. Logan sidesteps and the wolf hurtles past, skiddi on the snow when he lands. Logan and the wolf circle each other, looking for weaknes The wolf gnashes its wet teeth and pounces again. Man and beast battle in the moonlight, a shadowy combat o ferocious velocity, of gleaming fangs and gray fur. The wolf lunges for Logan's throat again, but this time L catches the wolf in one hand and slams it to the snow. The wolf, desperate to escape, rakes Logan's arm with his claws. Logan ignores the bloody welts. rC)NTTNTTF.T) )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His face is close to the wolf's face and they stare into other's eyes, predator to predator. Snikt! Logan presses the claws of his left hand to the wolf's throat. The wolf quits fighting, mewling submissively. He goes slack in Logan's grip, rolling over to signal surren Logan stands over the newly-subservient alpha wolf. The o wolves in the pack stare at the strange champion. Intense light shines on Logan's face. He turns and sees t he's surrounded by a dozen SOLDIERS wearing tactical armo Powerful flashlights are mounted to the barrels of their guns, which are pointed at Logan. The wolves flee, dodging through the pines, their paws kicking up snow.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Put your hands in the air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker and the others are able to watch Logan in action, night-vision security cameras mounted in the trees beam a constant live feed back to monitors in the control room.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: These soldiers are the creme de la creme. They're equipped to handle the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan tries to gauge his enemies, staring into the harsh lights- He growls.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Hands in the air, now! Logan charges at the soldiers. The soldiers fire their weapons. These are not rifles but high-powered Tasers. Twelve darts sink into Logan's skin, each connected to a silvery wire. Thousands of volts of electricity course through Logan's body. (fC)NTTNIJF.n

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gritting his teeth and fighting through the pain, he slic the twelve wires with his claws and advances on the stunn soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monitors show the fallen soldiers lying in the snow. a moment everyone in the room is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: The creme de la creme just got creamed. Stryker gives her a very nasty look before turning to Gen Munson and speaking in calming tones.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: There's a high-voltage fence on the perimeter of the base--

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: Is it made out of adamantium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old Chevrolet pickup truck rattles down a snow-covered road that passes acres of frozen farm fields. A Good Sam sticker is pasted on the rear bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES and HEATHER HUDSON, a middle-aged farmer and his mi aged wife, are bundled up in heavy parkas. James drives; wife talks.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER HUDSON
dialogues.text: Marge'll probably make her walnut pie again. I thought I'd do meringues this year. Try something different. Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER HUDSON
dialogues.text: You like my meringues, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: Yep. ((Y)NTTN!JRr 1

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER HUDSON
dialogues.text: (GOOD-HUMORED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Yep. Forty years of conversation, all I get is yeps. Heather grabs her husband's arm. HEATHER HUDSON (cont'd) Jimmy! James turns in time to see a naked man sprint across the and slip inside a red sheep barn. HEATHER HUDSON (cont'd) I think there's a naked man in the barn.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: .yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James Hudson cautiously slides his barn door open. He hol an old shotgun in his hands, a gun he hasn't fired in yea He advances slowly into the barn, sunlight from the open falling on the scattered straw. A vintage motorcycle cove in a tarp stands near the side wall. Hudson looks inside each sheep pen. His thick-wooled SHEE ready for breakfast, bleat hopefully. In the third pen Hudson finds Logan, who has covered hims with straw. A few curious sheep sniff at the fugitive's f Hudson stares at Logan, who stares back somewhat, well, sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: Son... What in hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Sorry... It's a little cold out there.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: Uh huh. It's the middle of January and you got no clothes on.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: That's probably it. (CFNTTNEWF )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hudson sighs and lowers his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: You're not on the drugs, are you?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: Just had a rough night?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Pretty rough, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: All right, come on. I got some old clothes'll probably fit you. He turns and Logan begins covering strategic places with of straw. JAMES HUDSON (cont'd) I'll take you around back so my wife don't see you again.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Sorry if I scared her.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: Scared her? (SNORTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not worried about you scaring her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sits at the breakfast table with James and Heather. wears an old plaid shirt, dungarees, and a pair of scuffe work boots. A heaping breakfast lies before him: scrambled eggs, pork sausages, pancakes with maple syrup, a steaming mug of coffee. Logan devours everything in front of him, looking up only nod in thanks as Heather scoops more food onto his plate.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: You mind if I ask where you came running from? r()NTTNITF.n )

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER HUDSON
dialogues.text: Jimmy. Let the boy eat. Logan piles eggs onto a slice of buttered toast.

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: I'm just wondering. We're twenty miles from town. It's a miracle you didn't get hypothermia out there.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I've got good circulation. (gesturing toward barn) Nice chopper you got out there, by the way. James's face lights up. Logan has found the man's passion

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: You know motorcycles?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What is it, '48 Panhead?

dialogues.speaker: JAMES HUDSON
dialogues.text: Best bike Harley-Davidson ever made. First one with a seventy-four- cubic inch engine, hydraulic valve lifters, aluminum heads-- Heather stands to clear the plates.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER HUDSON
dialogues.text: Now you've got him started. You need more of anything? Logan, smiling, holds up his hands to surrender. The smile fades when he sees the red laser dot appear on Heather's shirt. HEATHER HUDSON (cont'd) What's the matter, honey? Logan dives across the table, trying to knock her out of way, but the bullet beats him there, punching through the window frame and straight through Heather Hudson's heart. She collapses in Logan's arms.

dialogues.speaker: GET DOWN
dialogues.text: But it's too late. A second bullet hits James in the back the farmer blinks and topples forward, dead before he hit -the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Zero lies on his belly three hundred yards from the farmhouse. He lowers his sniper rifle and speaks into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Weapon X is in the farmhouse. He just murdered.two civilians.. Fire at will. An APACHE LONGBOW helicopter streaks overhead, fifty feet above the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan checks James Hudson's pulse but finds none. He look when he hears the thrum of the military helicopter. Two Good Samaritans lie dead at his feet, slaughtered for sheltering him. Something bestial has. entered Logan's ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Apache circles the farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both the PILOT and the GUNNER wear helmets with monocular eyepieces that provide images from the external cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The farmhouse is centered in the crosshairs. Scrolling numbers to the side of the image indicate the range in meters. The gunner's finger tightens on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: INT_ KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Logan growls and runs for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunner squeezes the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Apache fires multiple Hellfire rockets, which blast o of their launchers and rip into the farmhouse. The old Hudson homestead collapses as the explosions blow the roof and the support walls.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNER
dialogues.text: Direct hit.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Locate the target and fire again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunner glances at his pilot. Both men seem mystified the command.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNER
dialogues.text: Sir... the target's destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Repeat: locate the target and fire again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Apache circles the smoking ruin where the house once stood. No sign of Logan is visible in the scorched debris

dialogues.speaker: GUNNER
dialogues.text: They must've hated this guy big time. t C'_C?NTTNTTRI)1

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: What was he, terrorist or something?

dialogues.speaker: GUNNER
dialogues.text: I don't know but he's a puddle now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Apache hovers near the sheep barn, rotor blades fanni the rising smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the gunner continues to scout the ground for any sign corpse, the pilot notices something out of the corner of eye. He stares at the roof of the sheep barn. A smoke-darkened figure stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, claws extended, skin blackened with soot, jumps fr the roof of the barn. He lands on the helicopter windshie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot nearly jumps out of his seat.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Jesus! Logan raises his right hand and plunges his claws through bulletproof glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Zero watches the Apache plummet to the ground. He snorts with amusement and activates his headset.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Your boy just took down fifty million dollars worth of hardware. Guess I got to do this myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker sits alone in his office, pinching the bridge of nose. It's been a long day for the colonel.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: (on headset) Negative. Come back to base.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Have a little faith, boss.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: You don't have the weaponry...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: Don't care what kind of bones he's got. Fifty caliber bullet through his eyeball ought to do it.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Nord, goddamnit--

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: I'm losing you, boss. Agent Zero clicks off his headset and.raises the sniper rifle, searching through the smoke with his scope. AGENT ZERO (cont'd) (muttering to himself) Come out and play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan emerges from the Apache's wreckage and runs toward sheep barn door. A bullet cracks him in the forehead and Logan falls backw into the snow, stunned. For a few seconds we can glimpse adamantium of his skull. His healing factor takes over and his skin begins to knit itself back together. Logan combat crawls inside the sheep barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the tarp off the '48 Harley. James Hudson resto this bike with love and elbow grease. The chrome and leat shine as brightly as any new model on the factory floor. The key is in the ignition. This used to be a safe neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan bursts out of the barn on the Harley. The tires spi the snow but Logan is an experienced rider. He steadies t bike, steers it onto the blacktop and accelerates, headin the opposite direction from Agent Zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Zero grabs his rifle and jogs over to a black SUV w tinted windows and off-road tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan speeds down the road, Agent Zero in hot pursuit. Ze gains ground, both hunter and quarry racing past 100 MPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Zero grabs an Atchisson assault shotgun from a rack behind his seat that holds an impressive array of weaponr He lowers the passenger window and gets a bead on Logan, swerves to keep himself (and his more fragile motorcycle) tricky target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Zero fires six shells in rapid succession. Hundreds steel pellets scream over the motorcycle, perforating the face of a smiling farmer on a fertilizer billboard. Logan turns and sees the SUV closing on him. Agent Zero r the bumper into the Harley and Logan very nearly loses control, managing to right the bike at the last second.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan accelerates and opens up thirty yards of breathing room. He turns and sees Agent Zero catching up again. Logan clamps on the brakes, hard. He holds out his left hand and extends his claws. The tip the blades scrape the asphalt and sparks fly. The SUV cannot brake in time. As it hurtles past the motorcycle, Logan's claws hit the SUV's front tire and sh it instantly. A split-second later he shreds the rear tir The SUV totters, falls to its side, and barrel rolls acro the empty road. It ends up on its roof in a drainage ditc wheels still spinning in the air. Logan turns his bike and pulls up next to the upended SUV lowers the kickstand, stands, and walks to the driver's s Agent Zero, bloodied and dazed, has managed to push open door. He leans out and aims his shotgun at Logan, who sli the weapon into four pieces with a sweep of his claws. Logan grabs Agent Zero by the back of the neck and hauls out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Those were good people back there. Innocent people. Agent Zero surreptitiously pulls a commando knife from a sheath on his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: You ever notice good people tend to die when they spend time with you? He swings the knife at the side of Logan's neck.`Logan catches Agent Zero's wrist and slams it against the door frame. Agent Zero drops the knife with a pained smile. He didn't think that would work. AGENT ZERO (cont'd) Maybe you should stick with the bad people. We're more your speed.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I got a message for your boss.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT ZERO
dialogues.text: (SMIRKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Tell me. The smirk fades from Zero's face as he sees the adamantiu claws plunging toward his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan stands at a pay phone beside the Texaco station, watching a couple of SKATEBOARD PUNKS practice their olli He punches in a number and waits for the connection.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Department of Agriculture.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Get me the Pest Control Division.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, there is no Pest Control Division.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Why don't you get 'em anyway. And tell 'em Logan's calling. While he waits he watches one of the kids attempt a backs tailslide on the curb. The kid loses his balance and wipe out, skinning his palms on the asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (controlled fury) You shouldn't have killed those people. All they were doing was helping a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker sits behind the desk of his office. His aide, COLLINS, stands on the other side of the desk, listening on an extension.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: You ran on me, goddamnit. We had a deal. Now you get back to base--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We continue to INTERCUT between the gas station and Stryk office.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: They had nothing to do with this. You let that mad dog gun 'em down like they were animals.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: I'm giving you an order, soldier! Return tobase--

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Had enough orders for one lifetime. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going after Victor Creed. For several seconds there is silence on the line.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: We're bringing you in. One way or another, we're bringing you in. Logan bows his head, considering his next words.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: People like you are always waiting for the next war. You start one with me, Colonel, you better sleep with the lights on. He hangs up the phone and walks to his bike. The skateboa punks give him a wide berth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing time at the big zoo and FAMILIES flock toward the parking lot. SANITATION WORKERS clean the trash from the walking paths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lemur habitat is cultivated to mimic the environment Madagascar. Four RING-TAILED LEMURS swing from the branch of the baobab trees, shrieking at each other. f rC)NTTNTTPD I

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They congregate in a small wooden hut with a peaked roof, where they scamper up and down the back of FRANCIS, a slender, balding man in a zoo keeper's uniform. Francis has a gentle smile as he feeds the lemurs leaf-ea biscuits. He speaks to them as they shriek,: clambering o his lap, biscuits clutched in their tiny hands.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: She did what? Ninna, that wasn't very nice. He gives one of the female lemurs an admonishing look. Sh shrieks and dances away, biscuit held to her chest. FRANCIS (cont'd) You must have done something to deserve it, Myrto. Oh, you bit her? Why? Haven't we talked about this? The lemurs all quiet down at the same time. Francis watch them. Something is wrong. The lemurs flee, ducking into h in the baobab trees, hiding from whatever's coming. Francis frowns and turns. Victor Creed stands above him.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Everyone thinks you're a lunatic, talking to animals. But I know you're not, Francis. You understand them, don't you? That's your power. Francis looks for help but there is no one in sight. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) What do they tell you? Francis is quiet for a few seconds, staring at the killer

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: Nothing very fancy. They tell me when they're scared. When they're angry. When they're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: You ever talk to a panther, Francis? Francis shakes his head. CONTTNi7Ff)1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ГЇВїВЅ1 VICTOR CREED (cont.'d) Every now and then a white panther comes along. Albino. The mama panther won't even look at it. She won't lick it, she won't feed it, nothing. So pretty soon the white panther dies. You know why? (off Francis's silence) White panthers are mistakes. And nature takes care of its mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: There are no mistakes. We're all part of the plan. We're all God's children. Creed grins, licking his sharp fangs.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: I don't know who my Daddy was, but it sure as Hell wasn't God. Francis bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCIS
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of dying. Creed runs one long claw across Francis's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: How do you know? You've never done it before.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Ninna the ring-tailed lemur mewls softly, trying to hide herself deep within the baobab tree as her human friend SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, riding James Hudson's vintage motorcycle, rolls do the famous strip, lit by the mammoth neon signs above him He stops at a red light and stares at the lonely moon ris over the desert.

dialogues.speaker: LADY OF THE NIGHT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You look like a man who could use a night off. (C fNTTNTTRT)1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan turns to look at a REDHEAD in a tight silver dress, waiting at the light in her Cadillac convertible. She loo like she's expensive, and she looks like she'd be worth i

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You're way out of my league, darlin'.

dialogues.speaker: LADY OF THE NIGHT
dialogues.text: You never know. You looking for a good time with a bad woman? Logan smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Not tonight. The redhead purses her lips.

dialogues.speaker: LADY OF THE NIGHT
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're missing. Logan revs his engine as the light changes.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I know exactly what I'm missing. The courtesan waits at the green light,. watching Logan s off into the night -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a seedy part of town, far from the casinos' bright lig Logan walks through the front door of a rundown boxing gy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even at this hour the gym is packed with aspiring PUGILIS Las Vegas has become the Mecca of world boxing, and many the fighters here exhibit impressive skills as they batte the heavy bag, tap at the speed bag, and jump rope. Logan walks toward a ring in the center of the gym. Two y BOXERS inside the ropes, wearing headgear and sparring gloves, dance around throwing quick jabs that don't land. JOHN WRAITH (45) stands outside the ring, watching this action with evident distaste. He wears a black cowboy hat sunglasses, and a handlebar mustache. He has the swagger drawl of a rodeo cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: This is a contact sport, ladies. If you don't like hitting people, try golf. Logan comes up behind Wraith, unseen by the Texan..

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You talk tough for a guy who always let me do the dirty work. A slow smile creases Wraith's face. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: Look at this. You never get old, do you? The two men'embrace. There is genuine affection here, the camaraderie of men who have fought together, bled togethe WRAITH (cont'd) Nobody followed you?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You tryin' to insult me?

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: Can't be too careful, brother. I've been retired five years I still check under the car every time I drive.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Victor Creed. Wraith's face goes serious at the mention of the name. He looks around the gym, making sure no one's watching them. He glances at the boxers in the ring, who lean on the rop and breathe heavily, awaiting instructions.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: Why don't you two get a manicure or something and meet me back here in the morning. (to Logan) Want a beer?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wraith leads Logan toward an office in the back, draping arm around his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: I love you like a brother. So I'm giving you thirty minutes. After that, you're too dangerous to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows in the office look out on the training boxers Wraith leads Logan inside and grabs two longneck bottles beer from a mini-fridge.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: What I hear, our friend the Colonel's got eyes all over the country looking for you. He ain't about to let Weapon X go rogue on him. Wraith pops the caps off the beer bottles and hands one t Logan.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What's Weapon X? They tap glass.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: You are. A walking, talking, hundred-million dollar experiment.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You know about it. Wraith sits behind his desk and puts his boots up. Logan across from him.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: I keep my ear to the ground. People like us, we never really quit the game.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I did. Woke up one day and knew I was done. Logan peels the label from his bottle of beer. f CONTTNTTFT) )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOGAN (cont'd) Stryker used to give me a new name every Monday. And by the end of the week, I'd draw a line through it. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I .put a whole lot of people under the ground. And one day I realized... Stryker was never gonna run out of names. Wraith nods, meditative.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: Our friend the Colonel has big plans.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What kind of plans?

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: Hear a lot of chatter about something called the Eleven. My boys in Arlington say it's the biggest covert weapons project since FDR built himself an atom bomb. Other than that, no one knows a goddamn thing. Wraith places his bottle on his desk and sits up straight his chair. WRAITH (cont'd) Look, I... I heard about what happened to your woman. For what it's worth, I'm sorry. Logan nods. He doesn't want to talk about it. WRAITH (cont'd) I did a little contract work with Creed back in the day. I've known some seriously foul people, but that cat... They say he took out a whole village in Nicaragua one time, every man, woman, and child, killed 'em all, just 'cause he was bored. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been screwed, sued, and tattooed, but I never killed no kids.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Creed did government work?

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: Till they got wise to him. Wherever he went there was a trail of bodies. And not always the right bodies, you know what I'm saying? There is murder in Logan's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Help me find him.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: He's a hard cat to track.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Just tell me where to start looking. I'll do the rest. Wraith taps the bottleneck, considering.
