dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: Might want to talk to his friends from the ultramax.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: The prison he busted out of?

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feds built it to hold the baddest of the bad mutants. Worked pretty well. Only problem-- now they all know each other. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever hear of a guy named Fred J. Dukes?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: People call him the Blob. You find him, you'll know why. Got out of the hoosegow a few months ago. Went home to Iowa. Town called Elgin.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You think he's still in touch with Creed? f C_ONTTNTIRT)1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wraith leans back in his chair and allows himself another slow smile.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: I bet you'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, on his Harley, speeds past a welcome sign for Elgi Iowa, Population 676.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neon Vacancy sign shines, a beacon for tired travelle in the heartland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan lies on top of the bed covers, hands behind his hea The lights are out and Fox News plays on the television, casting the small room in blue light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPORTER stands in a Detroit alleyway as POLICE OFFICER the background cordon off the area from ONLOOKERS.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: This is the 13th confirmed mutant slaying of the last two months, and with the investigation apparently stalled, members of the mutant community are voicing their outrage. A YOUNG WOMAN wearing a "Mutants are Humans, Too" t-shirt speaks passionately for the camera.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Of course there's bias at work here. If these were normal people getting. chopped up, you better believe there'd be an FBI Task Force investigating, there'd be all sorts of resources allocated to find this killer. Why is it that when violence is done to our community, the nation turns its back? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: YOUNG WOMAN (cont'd) If the government can't protect us, we're gonna have to start protecting ourselves. In the corner of the TV screen, carved directly into the brick wall of the alley, is a crude smiley face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan's expression does not change as he watches the repo Our only indications that he's boiling inside are the loo dark vengeance in his eyes, and the fingers of his right hand, which clench into a fist, unclench, clench again. He lowers the volume with the remote, picks up the teleph and dials a number. We hear four rings.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (on answering machine) Hey, you've reached Kayla and Logan. We're not home right now so please leave a message after the beep and we'll get back to you as soon as we can. Bye! Beep. Logan replaces the receiver in its cradle and' lies back, alone in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOTHER pushes her shopping cart towards her minivan. He young, freckled SON holds her hand, gazing fearfully at Logan, who stands on the edge of the lot smoking a cigar. looks out of place in this quiet, Midwestern town. Logan winks at the kid. He drops his cigar, grinds it out with the toe of his boot, and heads for the supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two STOCK BOYS, wearing bright blue vests over red shirts stand at one of the aisle dividers, hiding behind a stack breakfast pastries. They are plainly terrified.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BOY
dialogues.text: Say something.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BOY
dialogues.text: You say something. It's your section!

dialogues.speaker: STOCK BOY
dialogues.text: Dude... The stock boy peeks around the divider. FRED J. DUKES, a.k.a., THE BLOB, stands in the center of the aisle, tear open bags of pork rinds and pouring them down his gullet. Dukes is the biggest man you've ever seen. By a long shot Just shy of seven feet tall and weighing in at half a ton he's beyond fat. Beyond obese. His eyes look like pinpricks in the swollen enormity of h face. When he shifts his bulk, ripples cascade down his flanks, his flesh trembling with each breath.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus, Dukes... Dukes, mouth and chin dusted with fried pork skin, turns head to examine the pest standing next to him. LOGAN (cont'd) Maybe it's time to give the pork rinds a rest. Dukes swings his arm. Despite his enormous mass, the man moves with surprising speed. Not quick enough to catch Lo though, who ducks beneath the blow. Dukes's forearm, thicker than a fire hydrant, smashes thr the steel shelving. Bags of pork rinds and potato chips tumble to the floor. Snikt! Logan shows his glittering claws to the big man. LOGAN (cont'd) I'll fillet you standing, fat man. That what you want? Dukes hesitates. That is not what he wants., LOGAN (cont'd) .Where's Victor Creed? Dukes grunts and bulls forward, toppling the heavily-lade shelves into the next aisle. Panicked SHOPPERS scream and for the exits. Dukes blasts through the cereal aisle, too, with a great rending of steel, his giant shoes crushing boxes of Lucky Charms as he stomps into the produce section. CONPTNi)F.T)1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A coconut bounces off Dukes's head. Enraged, the giant tu and sees Logan standing by a pile of hairy coconuts, toss one in his hand like a baseball. LOGAN (cont'd) You're gonna help me, bub. You_just don't know it yet. Dukes bellows and runs at Logan. A coconut pelts him in t face, angering him further. Logan jumps out of the way as Dukes brings down his massive fists. Coconuts explode. Dukes charges after Logan, shattering watermelons, stacke grapefruits, clusters of bananas. After a thirty second rampage Dukes is exhausted, his gia chest heaving as he gasps for air, his hands and face splattered with remnants of crushed fruit. Logan jumps onto Dukes' back. The fat man roars and spins around, trying to buck the little rider, but Logan's got arm wrapped around Dukes' throat and he's not letting go. The spinning makes Dukes a little dizzy and he slows down Three adamantium claws shine in the big fellow's face, reflecting the overhead fluorescent lights. Dukes quits, his massive shoulders slumping. He sinks to knees, his great bulk splitting the linoleum floor. Logan presses his claws against Dukes' quivering jowls. LOGAN (cont'd) Where's Creed?

dialogues.speaker: FRED J. DUKES
dialogues.text: How the hell would I know?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Come on, he's your friend. When was the last time you talked to him?

dialogues.speaker: FRED J. DUKES
dialogues.text: Friend? He don't have any friends. All he's got is victims.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Careful, Dukes. I can smell a lie before you even tell it. The Blob begins to cry, the great bellows of his cheeks trembling, tears and snot dribbling down his face.

dialogues.speaker: FRED J. DUKES
dialogues.text: I'm not lying! I don't know where he is. Logan pulls a handkerchief out of his back pocket and han it to Dukes.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: All right, take it easy. Dukes blows his nose into the handkerchief, one of histor loudest and most violent nasal ejaculations. He offers back the soiled handkerchief. Logan waves it of LOGAN (cont'd) It's a gift. Dukes takes a deep breath, gathering himself.

dialogues.speaker: FRED J. DUKES
dialogues.text: You ever been to Superior?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: The club for mutants? Down in New Orleans?

dialogues.speaker: FRED J. DUKES
dialogues.text: Creed likes to party down there. Talked about it all the time-- how hot the girlies were. That's all I know. Logan shaves Dukes' jaw with the edge of his claw.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Nah. You know more than that. Dukes tilts his face, trying to keep his face from gettin scraped off.

dialogues.speaker: FRED J. DUKES
dialogues.text: Joint's owned by a guy named Barbarus. Shared a cell with Creed in the ultramax. Anyone knows where to find him, it's Barbarus. Logan stares into the Blob's face, gauging the man's word

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: He better be there, Freddie. And he better know something good. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( r'nNT T NT TF.n )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOGAN (cont'd) 'Cause I'm in a mood for violence and you're way too big to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker stands by a window-overlooking Alkali Lake while General Munson sits at the head of the conference table.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: we have information that he was in Las Vegas two nights ago. We'll find him soon.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: This is turning into a goddamn disaster, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: I disagree. I'd say the experiment has been a success.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: Success? Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Weapon X is a prototype. Nothing more. He's the walking proof that enhanced skeletons are viable. That, along with the healing factor we've replicated from his blood, will insure that the Eleven is capable of protecting our species from extinction. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point, Logan is merely an inconvenience. He won't be for long.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, William. I've lost confidence in your leadership. I'm going to recommend your dismissal to the Joint Chiefs. Stryker stares out the window at the distant lake, with n visible reaction to the General's words.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Disappointing, General. Expected, but still... disappointing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: General Munson takes a sip of water from the glass in fro of him.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MUNSON
dialogues.text: I know you believe in what you're doing. But I don't. War with the mutants is not inevitable. The general coughs. He begins to look confused as he coug again, his breathing gone suddenly ragged. He clutches at chest. A thin smile curls Stryker's lips. He turns to regard the General.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: You're having a massive heart attack, sir. Leading cause of death for men in your age bracket. The general gasps for air, trying to rise to his feet. In death throes, he knocks the glass of water from the table shatters on the floor. STRYKER.(cont'd) The war is coming. It's time to choose sides. The general collapses-and Stryker stands above him, stari down at the dying man with pitiless eyes. STRYKER (cont'd) You chose treason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavy rain falls in the French Quarter. There is no sig outside the club, only.a gargantuan BOUNCER standing in f of an unmarked door in a dark alley. The bouncer apprises the stocky mutant walking his way.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: You superior? Only when we go CLOSE ON THE BOUNCER do we realize he has single eye, large and bloodshot, centered in his forehead Logan raises both hands. Snikt! A single claw extends fro his right hand. (ONTTNTTF.T) )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He shoves the claw straight through his left palm, retrac the blade, and shows his wounded palm to the bouncer. The bouncer sees the wound heal and opens the door. BOUNCER (cont'd) Welcome home, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dimly-lit club is the size of a warehouse and jammed PARTYING MUTANTS. Most of them look like normal humans bu few are "overts," distinguished by curling horns, scaled and other genetic abnormalities. A sexy WAITRESS walks by with a tray of drinks. She winks Logan. A "Kiss Me, I'm a Mutant" button is pinned to her shirt. Industrial beats pour out of speakers bolted to the ceili Logan surveys the room. A young PUSHER approaches, his lo sideburns shaved into scimitars running down his jawline.

dialogues.speaker: PUSHER
dialogues.text: You lookin' for help, man? Ups, downs, in-betweens. What you need?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Wild roses for the moon.

dialogues.speaker: PUSHER
dialogues.text: Wild roses... That some new hash out of Amsterdam?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Something like that. You seen my buddy Barbarus? The dealer points toward a staircase at the back of the c

dialogues.speaker: PUSHER
dialogues.text: VIP room. But hold up,bro,.I got what you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Trust me, bub-- you don't. Logan heads for the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan tries to enter the VIP room but a muscle-bound SKIN with Mutant Power brands on his biceps blocks his path.

dialogues.speaker: SKINHEAD
dialogues.text: Private party.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I'm on the list. Logan. The skinhead raises his clipboard and examines the list.

dialogues.speaker: SKINHEAD
dialogues.text: Last name? Logan's fist splits the clipboard and crushes the skinhea nose. The muscle-bound brute slumps to the floor, unconscious. Logan steps over him and into the VIP room.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIP MUTANTS -sit at plush booths, downing shots of tequila. They grope their GIRLFRIENDS. They arm wrestle a compare tattoos and gobble down fried oysters. BARBARUS sits in a corner booth. He wears a custom-made w beater. The brutally-muscled mutant has four arms, all sleeved in tattoos. One hand pours himself a new glass of Jack Daniel's. A se hand gouges his name into the table top with a black stee commando knife. The third drums the beat of the current s on the vinyl booth's backrest. The fourth hand pets PANTERA, the nubile mutant sitting o his lap, a beautiful young woman entirely covered in glistening black fur. Her yellow eyes glitter. Logan approaches the table. Barbarus stares up at him. Pantera purrs, yellow eyes on Logan.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARUS
dialogues.text: (nuzzling his girl) Oh, I heard about this li'l fella. Mr. Creed beat him to hell.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I came back. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARUS
dialogues.text: Somewhere in America. Doing what he does best.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: BARBARUS
dialogues.text: Putting people's insides on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: He's killing mutants, bub. Barbarus smiles, twenty fingers drumming on the table top

dialogues.speaker: BARBARUS
dialogues.text: Some mutants need killing.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You got that right. Snikt! Barbarus shoves his girlfriend out of the way and stands, unsheathing three more black commando knives from his bel The other MUTANTS quiet down, watching the fireworks. Barbarus swings, the four knives whistling through the ai Logan ducks under them and continues to bob and weave as Barbarus advances behind a whirlwhind of black steel. Logan slashes and one severed hand falls to the ground. Barbarus howls, stabbing at Logan with his three good arm Logan's claws flash through the air again, and another ne severed hand lands on the table. Logan retracts his claws and curls one finger: come at me Barbarus, shamed and furious, gathers himself and charges Logan times his punch perfectly, pivoting on the ball of foot and hitting Barbarus with an uppercut that sounds li well-hit baseball. Barbarus crashes to the floor. Pantera hisses and pounces Logan, her black claws aimed at his face. Logan backhands her. She hits the floor and slides across the hardwood. C_nWTTAATFT)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan kneels beside Barbarus. LOGAN (cont'd) You want to keep your other hands? Where is he? Blood dribbles from Barbarus's lip. He spits out a tooth.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARUS
dialogues.text: He don't sent me postcards.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: No? Way I hear it, you two were practically boyfriends before he busted out.

dialogues.speaker: BARBARUS
dialogues.text: Busted out? (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been misinformed. Victor Creed got himself a government pardon. Some fellas from the Department of Agriculture came and picked him up.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You're lying to me. Barbarus grins, his teeth red from the blood in his mouth

dialogues.speaker: BARBARUS
dialogues.text: No, sir. But somebody is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A five-story concrete parking structure on the edge of La Vegas. John Wraith walks to his black.'68 Mustang, whistl a Jerry Jeff Walker song. When he gets to the car he drops to the floor and checks underbody for bombs. Nothing down there. He stands, reaching into his pocket for his keys.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You think I'd use a bomb on you, Johnny Boy? Wraith spins around. Victor Creed sits on a concrete para the desert wind blowing his filthy blonde hair. He hops off the parapet and walks toward Wraith.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VICTOR CREED (cont'd) It's all about human contact for me. Wraith quickly unlocks the car door and get in. He slips key into the ignition. The engine turns on the first try. Wraith hits the gas and the Mustang squeals out in revers He slams on the brakes, shifts into drive, and guns the c right at Creed. An instant before impact, Creed sidesteps the car and pun through the driver's window. It's a miracle of a punch, timed perfectly, a crushing sh to Wraith's jaw. Wraith loses control. of the car and it sideswipes a parked Hummer, spinning to a stop against a concrete wall. Wraith blinks and tries to clear his head. Creed reaches inside the broken window and hauls the Texan out. He lift the bleeding man into the air and flashes his white fangs VICTOR CREED (cont'd) Hear you been talking out of school.

dialogues.speaker: WRAITH
dialogues.text: He'll find you.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: That's the plan. It's a lot easier than finding him. Creed slams Wraith against the concrete wall and plunges claws deep into Wraith's gut. The Texan's mouth opens as the full force of the pain hit him. Creed whispers in his ear. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) I can feel your spine, Johnny Boy. A sickening crunch as vertebrae are crushed like walnut shells. VICTOR CREED (cont'd) Never knew you had one. Creed drops Wraith's body to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carol Hines, the Army surgeon last seen in Alkali Lake, unlocks her front door and steps inside her house. she looks exhausted, with deep circles under her eyes. Sh puts her keys and the mail on a table by the door and the looks up, startled, when she hears SHRIEKING. Hines, very nervous, advances into the dark kitchen. She flicks on the lights. A red kettle on the stove top whistles. A mug waits on the counter. Hines, mystified, t off the burner.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Pour yourself a cup of tea. Hines spins around. Logan sits at the kitchen table, an u cigar in his mouth. LOGAN (cont'd) It's gonna be a long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both sit at the kitchen table now. Logan smokes his cigar and watches Hines, who clutches her mug of tea with trembling hands. Logan watches her through the haze of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Careful, Doc. I can smell a lie. I can hear it. Maybe you start to sweat a little bit. Maybe the pitch of your voice changes. But I'll know. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Creed. Hines opens her mouth, closes it, opens it again.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: I can't. Please... you don't know what they'll do to me.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Nope. But I know exactly what I'll do to you. (rnNTTNT1FT) I

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hines stares at Logan and he stares back.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. You're different than they are. You wouldn't hurt an innocent person.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You're not innocent, Doc. He leans forward, forearms on the tabletop. LOGAN (cont'd) What does Victor Creed have to do with the Weapon X program?

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: It's not the Weapon X program, it's the Weapon Ultra program. Started sixty-five years ago. They've been trying to make the perfect soldier for a long time. First to fight the Nazis. Then the Communists. Now it's mutants.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: So where does Weapon X fit in? Hines closes her eyes and takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: You don't understand. X is a letter but it's also a Roman numeral. Weapon "Ex" is a nickname. Officially, you're Weapon Ten. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor Creed is Weapon Nine. Hines watches him, unsure how he'll react. HINES (cont'd) Both of you are experiments... prototypes. The final product is almost ready. Weapon Eleven. Logan's face darkens as the extent of his betrayal become clear to him.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Creed works for Stryker. Hines nods. I CONTTNi]RM

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOGAN (cont'd) Be ordered it. He ordered Creed to kill her. Hines can see Logan's mounting fury. She holds up her han

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: I don't know about anyone getting killed. I'm just a scientist. I work in a lab sixteen hours a day.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Just following orders, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: He was your commanding officer for years. How many people did you kill on his orders? Logan stares at her for a long count. she stares back, terrified but resolute.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: All this time I been hunting Creed, and he's just a puppet. It's Stryker pulling the strings. He stubs out his cigar on the breakfast table. LOGAN (cont'd) You ready to stop following orders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker stands at the window overlooking Alkali Lake. Dr. Cornelius steps into the room, holding a black leather ca

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: The Eleven will be ready within 24 hours.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Sir... Lieutenant Hines hasn't reported to base today.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Hines?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stryker considers the information for a moment and nods. STRYKER (cont'd) All right, thank you, Doctor. (glancing at case) What's this? Cornelius sets the case on the table and opens it. Six gleaming, armor-piercing bullets rest in green felt niche

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: We saved the leftover adamantium from the Weapon X procedure. Stryker plucks one of the bullets from its niche and roll between his fingers, examining it with a practiced eye. CORNELIUS (cont'd) Each one's got a high-explosive core. Two in the head and Logan's brain will have to regenerate from scratch.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: They won't kill him?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: According to the computer models we ran, there's a 30 percent chance his healing factor will reconstitute the gray matter. But those synaptic bridges that form our memories? Gone. If he survives, his brain will come back fresh.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: A blank slate... easy to train. Stryker fondles the shining bullet lovingly. STRYKER (cont'd) She's a pretty little thing.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: She ought to be. That's the world's most expensive bullet. Stryker pulls a revolver from his shoulder holster, dumps standard rounds, and begins loading the adamantium bullet (rfNTTN11F.T 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CORNELIUS (cont'd) There's another way, a more reliable way, to break down his memory.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Mm?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Only problem is, the procedure can only be done here at Alkali Lake. Stryker swings the chamber shut and holsters his gun.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Oh, he's coming back, Doctor. We have what he's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines, driving an old Ford, pulls up.to the guard house a the perimeter of the compound. A YOUNG SENTRY salutes her

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SENTRY
dialogues.text: Morning, Lieutenant. Hines smiles brightly, trying to hide her nervousness.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Good morning! The sentry looks into the car's cabin. The passenger seat empty. The back seat is empty.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SENTRY
dialogues.text: Could you pop the trunk for me?

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: The trunk?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SENTRY
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. It's all standard procedure but Hines is close to panicki She opens the glove compartment and hits the trunk releas The sentry inspects the trunk... nothing but a coil of ro and a roll of electrical tape. He slams the trunk door. YOUNG SENTRY (cont'd) You have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He signals to a second SENTRY standing inside the guard house, who hits a button. The steel gate rolls open and H drives into the compound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines steps out of her parked car and looks around. No on in the immediate vicinity.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: It's safe. Logan crawls out from the underbody, where he had been clinging. He dusts himself off.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Were you aiming for every speed bump in the state?

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: We find a uniform that fits. A well-built SERGEANT walks toward his vehicle, paging through requisition papers on a clipboard. LOGAN (cont'd) That ought to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines and Logan, who now wears a crisp uniform with a sergeant's stripes and a black beret, walk into the build

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: You have some blood on your shirt. Logan sees the drops of blood and tries to blot them out.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I barely hit the guy. They don't notice as a small security camera near the entrance pivots, its black eye watching the intruders. (C'ONTTNI]F.n )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hines, very nervous, tries to keep her composure. Logan p a hand on her shoulder-- partly to steady her nerves, par to keep pushing her forward. LOGAN (cont'd) Time to visit the Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines and Logan walk down a long corridor. Several SOLDIE and SCIENTISTS walk by, most of them ignoring the pair. One young scientist in a lab coat hurries past, nodding a Hines.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy. Hines waits till Murphy passes. She stops in front of a locked door and allows a laser scanner to read her retina The door slides open. Logan looks through the open doorway, his nostrils flarin He looks primed for homicide.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I can smell him. He walks through the door. Hines checks to see if the coa is clear.and follows him. Neither notices the security ca mounted on the ceiling, swiveling to track their movement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan and Hines stand at the top of a steel staircase, fo feet above the concrete floor of a massive cavern. Created in the 1960s by an underground hydrogen bomb test the Alkali Lake cavern is the second biggest in the count smaller only than the salt caverns of the Gulf Coast, hom the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The sheer scale of the place is staggering. Three times t size of the Super Dome, with walls of rough granite, the cavern is loud with the constant thrum of ventilation and high-powered machinery. Heavy steel pillars support the ceiling of the cavern. Ten thousand stainless steel isolation tanks crowd the fl arrayed in a grid, each tank slightly larger than a coffi TECHNICIANS walk in between the tanks, checking gauges, writing notes in clipboards. More technicians sit on a raised podium in the center of cavern, overlooking the Eleven, entering information into computers that monitor the sleeping army. Logan is awed by the sight. Hines has descended the stair ahead of him. He follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Welcome to Weapon Eleven.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was just gonna be one guy. This is...

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Ten thousand. They reach the cavern floor and walk amongst the Eleven. HINES (cont'd) Stryker says mutants and humans will fight a war soon. (gesturing to Weapon XI) This is his army. The camera glides over the isolation tanks as Hines conti to speak. We catch glimpses of the ELEVEN inside, comatos soldiers with needles and wires protruding from their ski exactly like Logan during the Weapon X procedure. The men all look identical and they all look oddly famili HINES (cont'd) They incorporate the most successful features of the previous Weapons. Enhanced skeletons, heightened senses, healing factor-- f r0NTTNTTF.T) I

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan stops beside one tank and looks at the man inside, floats in his chemical sleep. His eyes widen when he real what he's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: It's Creed... He looks inside another tank. Same cruel face, same power body. Only their shaved heads distinguish them from Victo Creed. LOGAN (cont'd) They're all Creed.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Stryker's most successful mutant hunter. They cloned him years ago. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel's been planning this for a long time. _ Logan walks through the midst of this vast, sleeping army surrounded by ten thousand replicas of his worst enemy.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: They get into the world, it's genocide.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: I think that's the general idea. Logan stops in mid--stride, head raised in the manner of hunting dog who has just caught wind of his prey. HINES (cont'd) What's the matter? Logan moves, walking quickly, nearly knocking over a technician entering data into one of the stasis pods.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Hey... Hines hurries after Logan, smiling apologetically at the annoyed technician.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Where you going? Logan never turns. f rONTTNUT n %

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Don't follow me. Hines stops, standing alone in the middle of the Eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan walks rapidly down the hallway, his pace accelerati as he nears a closed doorway. He rests his head against t door for a moment before putting his hand on the knob and entering the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker sits behind his desk, smiling at Logan. But Logan not looking at the colonel. He's looking at the young wom who sits across from Stryker, her back to the door. She doesn't turn. Her long black hair cascades down her b

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Hello, old friend. We've been waiting for you. Logan walks toward the desk, slowly now, a man in a night he can't wake from. STRYKER (cont'd) Did you really think we just let you walk away three years ago? You're a dangerous man, my friend. We like to keep an eye on dangerous men. When Logan reaches the young woman he puts his hand on he shoulder. Kayla Silverfox turns and stares up at him, tears streami down her face.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. An aluminum baseball bat whirs through the air, smashing back of Logan's head. Logan falls to the floor, unconscious. Victor Creed stands above him, staring at the flattened barrel of the baseball bat. f nNTTNITFT)1

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Man's got a hard head.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: (STANDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. He'll only be out for a couple minutes. Creed tosses aside the bat and lifts Logan onto his shoul as easily as a normal man would lift a child of six. He carries Logan out of the room, winking at Kayla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan, still unconscious, sits on a chair that looks far similar to an electric chair, his arms and legs bound wit titanium manacles that prevent any movement. The room looks like an execution chamber, complete with a viewing window. He opens his eyes and blinks in the bright light. Stryker Creed stand in front of him but Logan doesn't look at the Dr. Cornelius and an ASSISTANT stand near a machine that wired to the electric chair, fiddling with the controls, Logan doesn't look at them, either. He stares at Kayla, who cannot meet his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (very quiet) You know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: No I don't.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: She's real, old friend. Your eyes are telling you. Your ears. Your nose. Logan ignores Stryker, staring at the love of his life.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You're dead. ('.ONTTNTWD )

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: I asked you nicely to join the program. And you were so stubborn. But I knew if nothing else could motivate you, revenge would. Stryker smiles at Kayla, a proud professor beaming at his student. STRYKER (cont'd) Tell him. Tell him about the day you died. Kayla, head bowed, is silent for a long count. When she speaks her voice is a strange monotone, devoid of feeling

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: They gave me a syringe full of hydrochlorothiazide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the colors are desaturated to let us know that th is a scene we've witnessed before, or thought we did. Kayla sits behind the wheel of her pickup. Victor Creed w toward her, black talons raking five gashes on the hood. Kayla has been expecting him. She pulls her backpack out behind the seat and takes from it a hypodermic needle and plastic IV bag filled with dark blood. Creed tears the truck's door off its hinges and tosses it twenty yards. Kayla injects herself with the hypodermic.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Reduces the heartbeat to almost zero. Breathing virtually stops. Makes you flatline for six minutes. Kayla hops down from the truck. She holds out the IV bag Victor, who casually pierces it with his claw. KAYLA (V.0.) (cont'd) I'd been drawing my own blood every night for the past week. I had four liters ready that morning. Kayla smears. her own blood on her body and empties the r of the bag on the pavement. She lies down in the puddle i fetal position, her breathing already beginning to slow.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Why? I

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA -
dialogues.text: Same as Victor. Stryker gave me a I choice: spend the rest of my life in prison or come work for him.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Prison... Kayla finally raises her head-and looks directly at Logan

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Shot my Daddy when I was eighteen. Big mistake. Should have shot him when I was seventeen.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You told me he died of a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Maybe he had a heart attack after I shot him. Sat there and watched him bleed. After what that man did to me, I wish he died slower. Logan stares at her for a long time. KAYLA (cont'd) That sweet little girl you lived with in the cabin? That was all make-believe.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You loved me. I know you loved me. Kayla blinks and looks away.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I'm a good actress.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: No one's that good. (C ONTTN1TF.f )

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Everybody's a sucker for something. Figuring out what it is, that's the trick. For you, it's a woman's love. An easy weakness to forgive. But still a weakness. Stryker signals to Cornelius. The doctor and his assistan attach a nasty-looking copper halo to Logan's skull. The is wired to the electric chair. Logan never takes his eyes off Silverfox. STRYKER (cont'd) Don't be angry at her. She was just serving her country, keeping the mutant menace in check. She and victor have been a real credit to their race. It takes Logan a moment to understand this comment.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You're a mutant?

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: My Daddy found out when I was twelve. Said a freak like me deserved whatever I got.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: My kind of guy.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: She's a gifted girl. She can plant thoughts in anyone's mind, make them believe what she wants-- as long as she stays focused on them. He strokes her long dark hair, proud of his protege. Kayl doesn't seem thrilled by Stryker's touch, but she endures STRYKER (cont'd) A useful tool in a seduction.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: (to Logan) Spent so much time getting you to love me, by the time the Colonel showed up I couldn't get you to leave me. (r0N'rTN1 F.n 1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dr. Cornelius finishes calibrating his machine and adjust the halo brace.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: We're good to go.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: So, Logan... The truth is, you're a real pain in the ass. But we've invested far too much time and treasure to terminate you. We're starting over. Cornelius checks the digital gauges on the machine.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: If I've calibrated correctly, we'll leave intact the hard-wired functions, walking and talking, all that good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: You mean I don't get to potty train him?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: But every memory you've ever had will evaporate. Just like it never happened. Logan never takes his eyes off Kayla, his personal Judas.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: (to Cornelius) Let me know when he's clean. I have to look in on our other guest. Stryker exits the room, followed by Victor.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (to Kayla) That story you told me... about the guy who goes to get flowers for the Moon. I can't get it out of my head. Except I had it all backwards. I thought you were the moon and I was your Wolverine. But you're the Trickster, aren't you? (MORE) ( ('ONTTNTTF.1))

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LOGAN (cont'd) And I'm just a schmuck who got played. Kayla is silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: My mother told me that story. She takes a deep breath and turns to go. KAYLA (cont'd) It doesn't matter. You won't remember any of this.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: You didn't trick me into loving you.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: The last two months, you weren't playing around in my skull. You weren't using. your powers on me. I thought you were dead and I loved you more than ever. Maybe it makes you feel better to think it was all fake. But it was never fake for me. Kayla lowers her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You don't know where I come from. You don't know what it was like.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I know exactly what is was like. I come from there too.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I didn't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Course you did. You still do. Kayla stares down at Logan. The tenderness returns to her face. She could free him right now if she wanted. The moment passes and Kayla shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. t C()NTTNTTPTI'

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, you keep saying that. (to Cornelius) Come on. Turn on the juice. Let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: Whenever you're ready, Miss Silverfox. Kayla turns and walks out of the room. Cornelius and his follow, shutting the door behind them. Logan takes a deep breath. He looks like a man who is rea to forget everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hines sits alone on a metal cot. The cell door slides ope Stryker and Victor step inside.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Lieutenant. Victor and I were just discussing how to kill you and we thought you might have some suggestions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silverfox steps out of the re-education chamber. She hear voices from the holding cell and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: When the Turks captured a traitor, they strapped a steel basket to the man's stomach. Inside the basket was a rat.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Now, even a rat can't chew through steel. But it can chew through a stomach. So it would. Right through the skin and the fat and the muscle and the intestines, right on out the other side. l CDNTTNi7ET) I

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hines looks like she might be sick very soon. Kayla steps into the doorway. STRYKER (cont'd) Victor thinks the Turks were soft, letting the rats do the dirty work. He's looking forward to spending your last night with you.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Please, Colonel-- Stryker pats Hines on the cheek and nods to Victor.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Enjoy yourself.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: Please don't do this... Please! Victor drags the screaming Hines off of her cot. Kayla watches with growing unease but Stryker smiles and- waves goodbye as he turns the key that shuts the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sits in his electric chair, staring straight ahead, preparing himself for the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cornelius stands behind the glass viewing window with his ASSISTANT. He puts his hand on a red switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of volts surge into Logan's skull, forcing his to arch. After several seconds the power shuts off. Tendr of white smoke rise from the copper halo. Logan opens his eyes and stares at Cornelius.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: That all you got?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: (to his assistant) This could take a while. Raise the amperage by forty percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker signs a memo and hands it to his aide, Collins. K stands by the window, picking at her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You're going to let Victor kill that woman. Stryker and Collins ignore her. KAYLA (cont'd) When you got me out of prison, you told me we were going to help people. Stryker continues to sign papers, never looking up.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: We are. We're saving humanity.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: From the mutants? The phone rings. Stryker answers it.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: Yes? (LISTENING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'm coming down. (hanging up; to Collins) The Eleven is ready. He stands and heads for the door. Collins follows. In the doorway, Stryker stops and fixes his cold blue gaze on Ka STRYKER (cont'd) Don't worry, my sweet. You're one of the good ones. I'll protect you. He and Collins exit the room, leaving Kayla alone with he misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan sits panting in the chair, gripping the ends of the rests with white fingers, waiting for the next surge of electricity. It comes and he arches again, all the muscle his body contracting, the veins in his neck bulging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cornelius and his assistant watch Logan with no detectabl sympathy. They turn when Kayla walks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Is he clean yet? Cornelius and the assistant face front again..

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: He's stronger than I thought. We could be here all night.. Kayla watches Logan in his agony. A glimmer of remorse pa over her face.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: He was good to me. Cornelius, fiddling with the amperage dial, curls his lip a sardonic smile.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: You have a funny way of showing your gratitude. Logan thrashes in his chair. Kayla chews her lip. For a l count she watches Logan suffer.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You should turn it off now. Cornelius turns and stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS
dialogues.text: I should what? (BLINKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I guess that's... I guess that's a good idea. He turns off the electricity. 1coNTTN IRD 1

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You two have always hated each other. You should fight. The assistant blinks and begins to scowl, turning toward Cornelius just in time to get punched in the mouth. The two men brawl on the floor with the lack of skill you expect from two scientists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kayla steps into the room. Logan sits slumped motionless the electric chair. She detaches the copper halo. The ski beneath the metal is singed but it quickly begins to heal Kayla stares at the man she betrayed, hesitates for a mom and exhales. She unfastens the titanium manacles. Logan is still unconscious. Kayla shakes him gently.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Hey. Wake up. Logan opens his eyes. He is clearly disoriented, as if wa from a long coma. He stares up at Kayla. KAYLA (cont'd) Are you okay? Logan stares at her, groggy and confused. KAYLA (cont'd) Do you understand what I'm saying? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember me? In one blinding motion, Logan snatches Kayla by the throa and roughly pulls her to him. She does not resist.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I would have done anything for you.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Do you hear me? Anything. (r0NTTNTTF.T)1

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Please... Creed's killing your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor Creed holds Hines against the cell wall with one h Her feet kick in the air as she struggles. He splits her blouse down the middle with a long black ta

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: I've always had a thing for human chicks. You're all so soft and helpless.

dialogues.speaker: HINES
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time I did a little surgery on you, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The woman said no. Creed turns his head and sees Logan and Kayla standing in doorway. He grins and tosses Hines aside. She crashes into the wal and slides to the floor, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: (to Logan) Starting to think you're addicted to pain. You keep coming back for more. Snikt !

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: This is the end.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Amen to that. Kayla stands in between them, holding up her hands.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Please! We shouldn't be fighting each other. Stryker's using us.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: A little late for the Mutant Power crap. We hunt freaks for the man. That's why we're free.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What's he gonna do with us when the other mutants are dead? Put us in a zoo? Creed hesitates, considering the logic of her words. A fa smile splits his face.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Don't try your head games on me. I've gutted better telepaths than you. Creed rears back to hammer Kayla, a blow that would separ her head from her body. Logan catches Creed's fist inches from Kayla's face.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Time you quit picking on girls.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm happy picking on men. Creed swings at Logan's head, Logan ducks, and the fight begins. This is melee so efficient that no motion is wasted. Ever lunge would kill any other adversary. Every parried blow would shatter a normal man's arm. Kayla, bleeding from the nose, staggers to her feet. She helps up Hines and pushes her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: Get out of here. Hines doesn't have to be told twice. She flees. Creed see his plaything running out the door. He snarls in frustrat

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: You're ruining my party. He grabs hold of Logan and hurls him headfirst through th cell wall-- a concrete support wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan crashes to the floor, covered in rubble. Creed step out of the cell, licking his fangs. Creed tries to stomp Logan's face, but the smaller man ro out of the way and gets back on his feet. The mutants battle down the corridor, claws whistling thr the air. A team of SENTRIES charge around the corner, wearing tact armor and carrying XM8 assault rifles. They level their rifles at the battling mutants.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: Get down! Get down!

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: Down on your knees! Logan and Creed, trying to punch holes in each other, ign the sentries. Kayla, staring down the barrels of the big guns,. holds up her hands. She concentrates, staring into the sentries' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: We're here as guests of Colonel Stryker. The sentries' hostility shifts into apologetic obeisance.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: Very sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: You boys are no longer needed here. Go back to barracks.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRIES
dialogues.text: You got it. See ya later. Bye! The sentries wave cheerfully and depart. Creed and Logan are equally skilled, but Creed's superior size and strength begin to wear the smaller man down. Creed slams him into the wall, opening fissures. Holding of Wolverine's wrists up with one hand, Creed grabs Wolverine's face with his free hand. (CONTTNI IRh )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His black claws slide toward Wolverine's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: How you gonna fight without eyes, little man? Logan brings his knee up hard, smashing his adamantium- enhanced kneecap into Creed's groin. The big man groans. Logan spins Creed around, jamming him against the wall. He tries to skewer Creed with the claws his right hand but Creed moves his head at the last momen Logan's claws are buried to the hilt-in the wall. He stri at Creed with his left hand, but Creed dodges again. All of Logan's claws are deep in the solid rock wall. He brings his hands. together, the adamantium blades slic through granite as if it were cheesecake. Creed ducks under the claws an instant before they shred He grabs Logan in a-bear hug. A large section of the wall behind them falls out, and, unable to halt their momentum, Logan and Creed tumble thr the hole, disappearing from sight. Kayla runs over and stands at the jagged precipice, looki out onto the gargantuan Weapon XI cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan and Creed fall seventy feet, clawing at each other mid-air. Logan hits the floor hard, the impact blasting a small cr in the concrete. Creed manages a rolling fall, cat-quick and dexterous.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Stryker stands on the raised podium in the center of the cavern, overlooking his vast, sleeping army. He cannot believe what he's seeing.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: (to Lead Technician) I want the Eleven combat ready. (cnNTTNIIF.T)1

dialogues.speaker: LEAD TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: We can't rush them,.sir. They've been in stasis for--

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: I want them ready! The Lead Technician flinches and barks orders to his subordinates, who enter commands into their computers. The lids of ten thousand isolation tanks slide open. As t camera roams among the Eleven, needles and hoses detach f their bodies, releasing their metallic grip. The cloned Creeds begin to stir in their stainless steel coffins.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Creed pounces on Logan, who is still severely injured fro the fall. Creed tears into the smaller man mercilessly, slinging him around the cavern, gouging him with his blac talons. Creed batters Logan with a series of savage blows. Logan falls, his healing factor overwhelmed, barely conscious. Creed plants one heavy black boot on Logan's face and pre down hard. He leers at his defeated foe.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR CREED
dialogues.text: Your pal Wraith pissed all over my boots when I crushed his spine. Smell like fear, don't they? Something changes within Logan, a fury so overwhelming it cannot be contained, a rage so vast it could only be call berserker. .Logan rolls toward his tormentor, sweeping his claws str through Creed's ankle, severing the foot. Creed screams and falls to his knees. Logan stands, grabbing a handful of Creed's dirty blonde hair.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: This is for the ones who couldn't fight back. ((`ONTTNTIRT) )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The adamantium blades are a silver blur in the overhead light.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Stryker, standing on the podium, sees his chief henchman' head tumble from his shoulders. He grits his teeth and surveys his army. Ten thousand enhanced warriors begin to step out of their steel coffins, baring their fangs, eyeing their surroundi

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: (to the Lead Technician) Activate the PA system. The Lead Technicians flips a switch. Stryker speaks into microphone; his voice booms from speakers mounted on the pillars throughout the cavern. STRYKER (c.ont'd) Soldiers! The Eleven snap to attention with machined synchronicity, ten thousand facing Stryker.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Logan, bloodied but healing, stares down at his fallen en

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Logan! Kayla runs down one of the steel staircases that clings t the cavern wall like fire escapes. KAYLA (cont'd) If we get closer to Stryker, I can work my magic. Logan stares at Stryker, his true enemy, the.man who destroyed his life. Ten thousand clones. encircle Stryker stands on the raised podium in the cavern's center.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: I don't want him hypnotized. I want him dead. Never taking his eyes off his enemy, Logan advances.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: I c_0NTTNTTF:T)1.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stryker sees Logan walking toward him, toward the hordes clones. Stryker shakes his head and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STRYKER
dialogues.text: The man's committing suicide. He leans into the microphone. The Eleven listen to their commander's voice, amplified by hundreds of speakers STRYKER (cont'd) No army that ever marched could stand against you! You will never abandon your mission, and your mission is simple! Kill the mutants! Kill them wherever you find them! Stryker points at Logan. STRYKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: THIS IS YOUR FIRST ENEMY
dialogues.text: Ten thousand cloned murderers turn on Logan, soulless bla eyes focusing on their target. Logan stops his march beside one of the massive steel pil that supports the cavern ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: (to Kayla) Get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Bringin' down the house. He sweeps his claws clean through the pillar, at an angle The uppermost section shears off and drills into the floo with a concussive whump that spiderwebs the concrete for thirty feet around the impact site. Stryker realizes what Logan is doing.

dialogues.speaker: ATTACK
dialogues.text: The Eleven charge. From above we can see the full-scale o the onslaught, wave upon wave of cloned murderers closing (CENTTN11FTl'

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Logan runs to the next pillar and slices through it. Crea and groans sound overhead, as the tremendous weight above exerts pressure on the remaining weight-bearing supports. Most of the ten thousand can't get close to Logan, but th all want in on the first kill. Whirling, slashing, stabbing, kicking, Logan scythes a ci of devastation, spray-painting the floor with the black b of the Eleven. He reaches a third pillar and chops through it. Kayla eyes the ceiling nervously and hurries toward the e STRYKER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: STOP HIM, YOU IDIOTS
dialogues.text: Even Logan can't hold back the tide for long. Talons rake face, his arms, his chest. But still he battles, slicing through a fourth pillar, a fifth. Tremendous fissures split the rock ceiling. Dust and rock fall onto the cavern floor as the fissures widen. Logan sees that the cavern's collapse is imminent. He can longer hold off the Eleven's assault. An instant before the clones can shred him, he jumps, usi his claws to scale one of the still-standing steel pillar with the grace and speed of a leopard climbing a tree. One of the clones follows, using his black talons in the fashion, grabbing at Logan's feet. When Logan is forty feet above the throng of teeth-gnashi clones, he severs the pillar below his feet. The clone chasing him can climb no farther, can do nothing but roar hiss at his escaping prey. Logan swings himself onto the steel staircase, where Kayl waits beside the open door. He races up the stairs. Stryker sees his dream in ruins. He runs for the nearest exit. Kayla and Logan are a few feet from the door, from safety when the cavern ceiling gives out. Thousands of tons of s and steel come crashing down. Logan grabs Kayla and hauls her to safety an instant befo she would be crushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compound has essentially imploded, the major structur falling into the massive pit created by the cavern's collapse. Severed gas lines and ruptured boilers have turned the cr into a raging fire pit. Smoke billows up from the molten core. A few dazed survivors, SOLDIERS and SCIENTISTS, have esca the carnage, but Alkali Lake no longer exists as a milita base. Thousands of singed documents flutter in the wind. Logan and Kayla walk away from the burning crater, never looking back. They head through the woods toward the lake that glitters in the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: One of them could have survived. Logan glances at her. KAYLA (cont'd) The clones. They've got your healing factor. Logan looks back at the devastation.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Unless someone comes along who can move a few million tons of steel, they ain't going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at the edge of the lake. Paper from the destroy base drifts through the air, falling on the water and the shore.

dialogues.speaker: LOGAN
dialogues.text: Almost looks peaceful from here.

dialogues.speaker: KAYLA
dialogues.text: There's something I want you to know. He looks at her. (CONTTNt1F.fl

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KAYLA (cont'd) Maybe nothing I say matters anymore. But I'm going to say it anyway. I... A blossom of blood opens up on her chest. She stares down it in wonder before sinking to her knees. Logan turns and sees Stryker walking toward them. KAYLA (cont'd) No... Stryker fires again. The adamantium bullet rips through Logan's forehead with an unholy sound. Logan falls to the ground. Stryker stands above him and f another bullet into Logan's head. Stryker turns the gun on Kayla. KAYLA (cont'd) You don't need to waste another bullet. I'm already dead. Stryker blinks and hesitates. Kayla coughs, her strength beginning to fade. KAYLA (cont'd) Maybe you should turn that gun on yourself, Colonel. Stryker nods, pointing the gun at his own head. KAYLA (cont'd) It would be good for the mutants if I made you pull the trigger.. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you hate us so much? Stryker's finger trembles on the trigger. KAYLA (cont'd) Is it because your son is one of us? For the first time, perhaps, we see something human in th cold blue of Stryker's eyes. KAYLA (cont'd) Enough killing, Colonel. Throw your gun in the lake. r (-nNTTNTTFT)1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stryker does as he's told. The revolver sinks into the wa KAYLA (cont'd) Leave us. Keep walking till your feet start to bleed. Stryker turns and walks away. Kayla crawls over to Logan. She lifts his head onto her l He's unconscious but breathing. The bullet holes in his s have already healed. She strokes his jaw. and smiles sadl One of the scraps of paper from the base blows against he leg. She takes it and looks down at the blank page. She has no pen. She touches her chest, just above her hea wetting her finger with her blood. She writes four words on the page, blows on it to dry it, folds it once and places it in Logan's hand. She kisses his lips and rests his head gently on the grou Fighting the pain, a dying woman, Kayla manages to stand. KAYLA (cont'd) If you ever remember what I did to you, try to forgive me. I was a fool. And you were right... I always loved you. She turns and walks toward the lake, never looking back, never hesitating as the waters rise above her knees, abov her waist, above her shoulders, above her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logan's eyes flutter and open. For a moment he squints in the blue sky. He sits up, looking around. The woods are empty. He stands, completely disoriented, a stranger in the worl He realizes that he's holding a piece of paper in his han He unfolds it and reads the message written in blood. You are my Wolverine. He stares at it for a moment before folding it carefully putting it in his pocket. f C ONTTNIIRD)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He takes a deep breath of cold air and walks west, toward falling sun. He doesn't know who he is. He doesn't know where he's goi But the wind blows through his hair, the last of the sunl feels good on his skin. He is a free man. He walks toward his destiny..
